result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J, Eisner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin no later than July 13, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin immediately.  The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Taylor County Case No. 15CF11

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Andrew J, Eisner in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Court questions defendant regarding his waiver to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Defendant waives reading of Information.  Plea of no contest to Count 1.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists. Court finds defendant guilty of count 1.  Court dismisses and read in the remaining counts.  Court orders - Count 1 withheld sentence probation for three years; 12 months county jail with huber begin no later than July 13, 2016 at 4:30 pm; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; reimburse buy money - $260.00; AODA and follow all treatment recommendations; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.
Waiver of Prelim on June 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on June 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 6, 2016 at 11:45 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Andrew J, Eisner in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised DE of charges and penalties; advised of right to attorney and notice given to DE.  Atty Tlusty requested signature bond in the amount of $5,000.00 with standard conditions and special conditions of: Defendant shall have no contact with T.J.S.-dob: 6-2-94.  Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.  DE responded.  Court orders bond as requested.  Pre-trial conference scheduled April 29, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. ba

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall have no contact with T.J.S.-dob: 6-2-94. Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
